recommendations.title: Adopt Four-Sprint v0.1 Plan
recommendations.summary: Complete v0.1 in 6-8 weeks across four sprints: Data Foundation → Atlas+Home → Detail → Lab
recommendations.rationale: Each sprint delivers independent user value. Progressive disclosure: context → explore → deep-dive → contribute.
conditions: Sprint 1 must complete before Sprint 2 (Atlas depends on data layer)
Home page can be drafted in parallel with Sprint 1

details.sprint_1: Data Foundation (1-2 weeks): IndexedDB schema, CSV migration, query API, tests
details.sprint_2: Exploration UI (2 weeks): Atlas 2D scatter + Home page markdown
details.sprint_3: Deep Dive (1-2 weeks): Detail page with animation + metrics + notes
details.sprint_4: Survey Growth (1-2 weeks): Resumable Lab + progress tracking

recommendations.title: Use Specified IndexedDB Schema
recommendations.summary: Two stores: 'rules' (ruleId primary key, indexed on lambda/dimension/gamma/classification) and 'collections' (auto-increment id)
recommendations.rationale: Simple, query-efficient, extensible for future topology support. Dexie can efficiently filter on indexed fields.
conditions: Migration must batch insert (1000 records at a time) to avoid memory issues
Add 'topology' field in Sprint 8 without migration (defaults to 'flat-torus')

details.stores: rules: 'ruleId, lambda, dimension, gamma, classification'; collections: '++id, name'
details.rule_fields: ruleId, birth[], survival[], lambda, dimension, gamma, period, classification, measured_at, notes

recommendations.title: Start with 2D Atlas, Defer 3D
recommendations.summary: Atlas MVP: 2D scatter (lambda x-axis, dimension y-axis), colored by gamma, sized by period. Interactive hover/click.
recommendations.rationale: 2D is easier to implement, performs better, and uses color for third dimension. 3D adds complexity without proven value in v0.1.
conditions: Revisit 3D in v0.2 if user testing shows demand
Use diverging colormap for gamma (blue=negative, white=zero, red=positive)

details.interaction: hover tooltip (rule notation + metrics), click to Detail

recommendations.title: Defer Interest Scoring to v0.2
recommendations.summary: No single 'interest score' in v0.1. Users explore (lambda, D, gamma) space visually with filters. Manual Collections for favorites.
recommendations.rationale: Interest is subjective. Visual exploration reveals patterns better than premature quantification. Let usage inform scoring algorithm.
conditions: Provide range sliders for lambda, D, gamma to isolate regions
In v0.2, consider user-adjustable formula (weighted distance from boring regions)

recommendations.title: Hierarchy Detection MVP = Period + Notes
recommendations.summary: Sprint 3: Display detected period (already measured). Add free-text notes field for manual annotation. Defer algorithmic detection to Sprint 5.
recommendations.rationale: Manual annotation is honest (doesn't promise AI that doesn't exist) and cheap to implement. Discovers what users want to track before structuring it.
conditions: Notes field is editable and saved to IndexedDB per rule
Sprint 5+ can add algorithmic still life, oscillator, spaceship detection

details.sprint_5_plus: algorithmic still life detection, oscillator catalog, spaceship detection

recommendations.title: Visualization Library Spike
recommendations.summary: Sprint 2: Benchmark Plotly.js (scattergl) vs Scatter-GL with 262k points. Choose based on render time, interaction responsiveness, API ease.
recommendations.rationale: Both libraries are viable. Empirical performance test determines winner. Default to Plotly if performance is comparable (maturity advantage).
conditions: Test with full 262k dataset (load synthetic data if survey incomplete)
Measure: initial render time, pan/zoom lag, hover latency, bundle size

details.plotly_cons: Large bundle (~3MB), not purpose-built for exploration
details.scatter_gl_pros: Purpose-built for embedding exploration (Google TensorFlow Projector), smaller bundle

recommendations.title: Communicate Incomplete Data Clearly
recommendations.summary: Display coverage percentage prominently. Show only surveyed rules in Atlas. Add tooltip about sparse sampling. In Sprint 4, add ghost points for unsurveyed rules.
recommendations.rationale: Transparency prevents misleading users. 8.6% coverage is sufficient to see structure, but must be labeled honestly.
conditions: Atlas Sprint 2: Show '22,590 / 262,144 rules surveyed (8.6%)'
Lab Sprint 4: Progress bar + ability to prioritize regions

details.sprint_2_atlas: Coverage display + tooltip warning about sparse sample
details.sprint_4_atlas: Ghost points (greyed out) for unsurveyed rules, clickable to add to queue

recommendations.title: Reorder Original Sprint Plan
recommendations.summary: Revised order: Data → Atlas+Home → Detail → Lab → Hierarchy+Collections → 3D/Polish → Topology. Key changes: Home earlier (Sprint 2), Lab later (Sprint 4), 3D deferred.
recommendations.rationale: Users need context before exploration (Home in Sprint 2). Atlas must exist before Lab to motivate survey completion. 3D is speculative, defer until proven need.
conditions: Stop and ship after Sprint 4 (v0.1 complete)
Sprints 5+ are v0.2, prioritized based on v0.1 user feedback

details.original_order: IndexedDB → Atlas → Home+Detail → Lab → Hierarchy → Collections → Polish → Topology
details.revised_order: Data → Atlas+Home → Detail → Lab → Hierarchy+Collections → 3D+Polish → Topology
key_changes: Home moved from Sprint 3 to Sprint 2 (context first)
Lab moved from Sprint 3 to Sprint 4 (after exploration motivates contribution)
Collections deferred to Sprint 5 (not critical for v0.1)

recommendations.title: v0.1 Success Criteria: Four User Flows
recommendations.summary: Ship when: (1) Home explains research, (2) Atlas lets me explore visually, (3) Detail lets me deep-dive any rule, (4) Lab lets me resume survey. Nothing else.
recommendations.rationale: Conceptual integrity = focused scope. Collections, Compare, 3D, hierarchy detection, topology are v0.2. Validate core flows first.
conditions: All four flows must work end-to-end
Performance acceptable (Atlas responsive with 22k+ points)
Home page clearly explains research question

recommendations.title: CSV to IndexedDB Migration Strategy
recommendations.summary: Sprint 1: One-time migration script. Parse CSV, batch insert 1000 records at a time using Dexie bulkAdd(). Verify count and spot-check rules.
recommendations.rationale: Existing 22,590 rules must move to IndexedDB. Batch insert avoids memory issues. Post-migration, IndexedDB is source of truth (survey writes directly).
conditions: Keep CSV export as backup option (File → Export CSV)
Migration must be idempotent (safe to re-run)
Verify B3/S23 exists with correct metrics after migration

details.approach: Parse CSV (Papa Parse) → batch insert (bulkAdd 1000 at a time) → verify
details.post_migration: Survey runner writes to IndexedDB directly, no CSV intermediate
details.backup: Provide 'Export to CSV' option in UI for data portability
